docs.abstract: A renovation of Cologne’s opera house is running eight years late, and cost estimates have doubled. It’s just one in a long list of public works gone wrong in the country.
docs.snippet: A renovation of Cologne’s opera house is running eight years late, and cost estimates have doubled. It’s just one in a long list of public works gone wrong in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: COLOGNE, Germany — “A fiasco,” said a local lawmaker, shaking his head grimly. “A shipwreck,” said a former head of construction for the city. The people of Cologne, known across Germany for their friendly cheer, lose their bonhomie when it comes to the renovation of their opera house and main theater.

headline.main: Budget Blowouts and Delays Blight Germany’s Major Arts Projects
headline.print_headline: It’s Not Over Till Divas Start Singing Again

docs.abstract: He didn’t publish his first novel (which he illustrated himself) until he was 46. But his impact, as both a writer and an artist, has lasted.
docs.snippet: He didn’t publish his first novel (which he illustrated himself) until he was 46. But his impact, as both a writer and an artist, has lasted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alasdair Gray, who wrote some of Scotland’s most celebrated — and strange — fiction, which he often interlaced with his own sharply etched illustrations, died on Dec. 29 at a hospital in Glasgow. He was 85.

headline.main: Alasdair Gray, Scottish Author of Daring Prose, Dies at 85
headline.print_headline: Alasdair Gray, Scottish Writer of Daring, Dreamlike Tales, Dies at 85

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Lanark: A Life in Four Books (Book)

docs.abstract: Mr. Steyer will join five other candidates onstage on Tuesday after registering double-digit support in Nevada and South Carolina.
docs.snippet: Mr. Steyer will join five other candidates onstage on Tuesday after registering double-digit support in Nevada and South Carolina.
docs.lead_paragraph: With two startling polling results released late Thursday afternoon, the billionaire former hedge fund executive Tom Steyer became the sixth candidate to qualify for next week’s Democratic presidential debate.

headline.main: Tom Steyer Qualifies for Democratic Debate With Two Surprising Polls
headline.print_headline: Steyer Sees Solid Gains but Faces an Uphill Climb

byline.original: By Maggie Astor and Nick Corasaniti

docs.snippet: Friday: Tell us what you want to know more about this year. Also: Why Eric Garcetti’s endorsement of Joe Biden matters; and Disney moms.

docs.abstract: An analysis of death certificates over nearly two decades contained several troubling findings.
docs.snippet: An analysis of death certificates over nearly two decades contained several troubling findings.
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of women drinking dangerous amounts of alcohol is rising sharply in the United States.

headline.main: Alcohol Deaths Have Risen Sharply, Particularly Among Women
headline.print_headline: Data Reveals Sharp Increase In Death Rate From Alcohol

docs.abstract: As they craft their disability rights plans, the 2020 candidates are consulting the people they would affect. “This is how policy should be made,” one advocate said.
docs.snippet: As they craft their disability rights plans, the 2020 candidates are consulting the people they would affect. “This is how policy should be made,” one advocate said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Christine Motokane could get long-term care to help her with daily tasks like cooking. Matthew Cortland could marry his longtime partner. Christin Lucas could stop worrying that her son’s school might put him back in the isolated classrooms that made him suicidal.

headline.main: Elizabeth Warren Opens a New Front in Disability Policy
headline.print_headline: Democrats, Led by Warren, Reach Out in Reimagining Disability Policy

docs.abstract: The strike was justified and legally sound.
docs.snippet: The strike was justified and legally sound.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week, our military and intelligence services brought justice to Qassim Suleimani, Iran’s terror mastermind. President Trump ordered General Suleimani’s killing after months of attacks on Americans by Iran’s proxy forces in Iraq. These attacks culminated in a rocket strike that killed an American and wounded others, then the attempted storming of our embassy in Baghdad. The first attack crossed the red line drawn by the president last summer — that if Iran harmed an American, it would face severe consequences. The president meant what he said, as Mr. Suleimani learned the hard way.

headline.main: The Case for Killing Qassim Suleimani

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: The owner of Neir’s Tavern in Queens said it would close on Sunday, barring a “miracle.” The city, it turns out, works in mysterious ways.
docs.snippet: The owner of Neir’s Tavern in Queens said it would close on Sunday, barring a “miracle.” The city, it turns out, works in mysterious ways.
docs.lead_paragraph: Loycent Gordon, who owns Neir’s Tavern in Queens, likes to call the place “the most famous bar you’ve never heard of.”

headline.main: After 190 Years, the ‘Most Famous Bar You’ve Never Heard of’ Avoids Last Call
headline.print_headline: In Queens, a Lifeline for the ‘Most Famous Bar You’ve Never Heard Of’

docs.abstract: It’s time to let the fantasy of the “British nation” die.
docs.snippet: It’s time to let the fantasy of the “British nation” die.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Kingdom may be finally coming to an end.

headline.main: Boris Johnson Might Break Up the U.K. That’s a Good Thing.
headline.print_headline: The Welcome Fall of the U.K.

docs.abstract: He almost single-handedly started the rush for the first wines of the Beaujolais harvest.
docs.snippet: He almost single-handedly started the rush for the first wines of the Beaujolais harvest.
docs.lead_paragraph: Georges Duboeuf, who transformed a quaint Beaujolais harvest ritual celebrating the year’s first wine into the global phenomenon of Beaujolais Nouveau, in the process turning his family’s small business into a worldwide powerhouse, died on Jan. 4 at his home in Romanèche-Thorins, France. He was 86.

headline.main: Georges Duboeuf, Creator of the Beaujolais Nouveau Craze, Dies at 86
headline.print_headline: Georges Duboeuf, Exporter Of French Wine Tradition To the World, Dies at 86
